discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Disabling Universal Plug and Play (UPnP) on the SOHO wireless router is the best way to ensure that incoming traffic is only allowed on specified ports. UPnP allows devices on the network to automatically discover and interact with each other, including opening ports for certain applications or services. However, disabling UPnP prevents this automatic port forwarding, ensuring that only manually configured port forwarding rules are active, thereby providing better control over incoming traffic.

questions.question_text: A SOHO wireless router needs to be configured so incoming traffic is only allowed on specified ports. Which of the following is the best way for the technician to accomplish this task?

choices.A: Physically secure access to the router.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I'm confirming what the other guy said. You have to secure your network first before doing anything else. C would be the answer

Selected Answer: C
Whenever you get a new router, the first thing you should do is change the password immediately. Changing the SSID doesn't mean better security, it just changes the name but the password still stays the same, that's why you gotta change that password ASAP. Otherwise any one can try and guess the default password.

comments.content: Changing SSID doesn't help security very much, if at all. You want to focus on securing your network first. If the SOHO router has been bought by the user, the default password is easily guessed. If it was provided by the ISP, the password is shown on the device, so anyone who sees the device will know the password.

questions.question_text: A user is configuring a new SOHO Wi-Fi router for the first time. Which of the following settings should the user change FIRST?

choices.A: Reinstall the application on the smartphone.
choices.C: Reset the smartphone to factory settings.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Question states. What should he do first? D Reboot the device obviously.

To resolve the issue with the frequent crashes and unresponsiveness of the calendar application on the employee's smartphone, the technician should first try option D: Reboot the smartphone.

Rebooting the smartphone can help in resolving temporary software glitches and may restore the proper functioning of the calendar application. If the issue persists after rebooting, then further troubleshooting steps such as updating the smartphone's OS or reinstalling the application may be necessary.

questions.question_text: The calendar application on an employee's smartphone is experiencing frequent crashes, and the smartphone has become unresponsive. Which of the following should a technician do first to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
The Windows OS that only recognizes 4GB of RAM is B. The 32-bit OS.

32-bit operating systems have memory limitations that restrict their ability to recognize and utilize more than approximately 4GB of RAM. In contrast, 64-bit operating systems can support much larger amounts of RAM, typically beyond 4GB. Therefore, if a system is limited to recognizing only 4GB of RAM, it is likely running a 32-bit version of Windows.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the Windows OS that only recognizes 4GB of RAM?

discussion.content:
A. RDP
B. VPN
RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol) allows users to access and control their desktop remotely, enabling them to work on their files and applications as if they were physically present at their workstations.

VPN (Virtual Private Network) creates a secure encrypted connection between the remote user's device and the company's network, ensuring that all data transmitted is protected from eavesdropping.

These two technologies, when combined, provide a secure and efficient way for remote workers to access company resources.

Google Gemini

To ensure secure remote access to servers and fileshares, the company should implement the following:

B. VPN (Virtual Private Network): VPN provides a secure encrypted connection over the internet, allowing remote users to access the company's network resources securely.

F. HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure): HTTPS encrypts the data transferred between the client and server, ensuring secure communication over the internet. It's commonly used for accessing web-based services and applications securely.

comments.content:
While HTTPS is essential for secure web communication, it's not directly used for remote desktop access or file sharing. HTTPS is primarily used to encrypt web traffic, ensuring that data transmitted between a web browser and a web server is secure. 

RDP and VPN are more suitable for remote access scenarios, as they provide a secure and reliable way to connect to remote devices and networks.

Google Gemini
